edu.gvsu.scis.cis350.termProject

Class CheckersModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gvsu.scis.cis350.termProject.CheckersModel

  • public class CheckersModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Class creates a virtual layout for the board and provides the game logic.
    Author:
    Andrew Olesak

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CheckersModel()
      Constructor creates the virtual board and places the pieces.

    • Method Detail

      • movePiece

        public final void movePiece(int startRow,
                            int startCol,
                            int endRow,
                            int endCol)
        Moves a piece from one spot on the board to another.
        Parameters:
        startRow - the row of the piece to be moved
        startCol - the column of the piece to be moved
        endRow - the row of the location to which the piece will be moved
        endCol - the column of the location to which the piece will be moved

      • canMove

        public final boolean[] canMove(int startRow,
                               int startCol,
                               int endRow,
                               int endCol)
        method decides whether or not a checkersPiece is allowed to move to a specific location.
        Parameters:
        startRow - the row of the piece to be moved
        startCol - the column of the piece to be moved
        endRow - the row of the new piece location
        endCol - the column of the new piece location
        Returns:
        an array whose first element is true if the piece isn't jumping, but is a valid move, otherwise false. The second element is true if the player is jumping and it is a valid move, otherwise false.

      • jumped

        public final int[] jumped(int startRow,
                          int startCol,
                          int endRow,
                          int endCol)
        Method decides the location of the player that has been jumped.
        Parameters:
        startRow - the row of the current checkersPiece
        startCol - the column of the current checkersPiece
        endRow - the row of the new checkersPiece location
        endCol - the column of the new checkersPiece location
        Returns:
        an array whose two elements are the row and column of the player who has been jumped respectively.

      • isWinner

        public final boolean isWinner()
        Method checks to see if there are any remaining pieces of a certain color to determine whether there is a winner or not. numOfPieces keeps track of how many remaining pieces are still on the board from the opposing team pRow the row of the remaining piece pCol the column of the remaining piece
        Returns:
        true if there are no remaining pieces of a certain color, otherwise false

      • canMoveAnywhere

        public final boolean canMoveAnywhere(int pRow,
                                     int pCol)
        Method calculates whether or not a given piece can make any allowed move in the game.
        Parameters:
        pRow - the row of the piece
        pCol - the column of the piece
        Returns:
        true if the piece has at least one possible move, otherwise false

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public final Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Returns:
        the current player

      • setNextPlayer

        public final void setNextPlayer()
        Switches the turn of the current player to the next player.

      • getPiece

        public final CheckersPiece getPiece(int row,
                                    int col)
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the checkersPiece
        col - the column of the checkersPiece
        Returns:
        the checkersPiece that is at the given row and column.

        public final void removePiece(int row,

        Removes a piece from a specific location.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the piece
        col - the col of the piece
